course_title: Fresh Sem: Africn Amer Studies: Sounds of Protest & Change:
requirement_designation: First Year Seminar with Race & Ethnicity(*)
class_notes:
Title: Sounds of Protest and Change


This course explores music, recorded sound, and literature relevant to US Civil Rights and Black Power political movements. We will read and listen to key voices, honing our critical listening skills to understand the dynamic sociopolitical milieu from which these movements emerged in order to hear resonances of multiple Black freedom movements in the tumult of the 1960's and 1970's.


(Freshmen Only)
course_description: Variable topics in African American Studies.
schedule_location: TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E101
